subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In mainland China, Japan and Korea, the inner dots of the character is written as {{l|mul|⿰[[⺀]][[⺀]]}}. * In Taiwan, Hong Kong and Vietnam, the inner dots of the character is written as {{l|mul|冫}} and its mirror image {{l|mul|⿱[[㇀]][[⼂]]}}. * When this character is used as an upper radical component, the form is different depending on the script used. ** For {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Ming typeface}} ([[明體]]/[[明朝体]]): *** In mainland China, Japan, Korea and Vietnam, the radical component resembles {{l|mul|⻗}} (U+2ED7) with four horizontal lines which is also the historical form used in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}. *** In Taiwan and Hong Kong, the radical component resembles the character itself (with {{l|mul|冫}} and its mirror image) but the lower right hook of {{l|mul|冂}} is omitted. ** For {{w|regular script}} ([[楷書]]): *** In mainland China and Japan, the radical component resembles the character itself (with {{l|mul|⿰[[⺀]][[⺀]]}}) but the lower right hook of {{l|mul|冂}} is omitted. *** In Taiwan and Hong Kong, the radical component resembles the character itself (with {{l|mul|冫}} and its mirror image) but the lower right hook of {{l|mul|冂}} is omitted.
